author: Anonymous Helix
title: Mutual reference (edX question)
question:
Really want to be sure I understand MR, but so far I would consider the Green and Light Purple (bottom left) arrows R, not MR.
(source)
Are these MR because they reference each other via third (or fourth) functions?
student_answer:
If you follow an arrow and it ends, it's a reference.
If you follow an arrow and get back to the same data definition in one cycle, it's a self-reference.
If you follow an arrow and go through multiple data defintions but eventually come back to the original, it is a mutual reference.
